author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
RJD chief Lalu Prasad being greeted after he filed nomination papers for the post of party’s national president inPatna on Friday.— Photo: Ranjeet Kumar

Lalu Prasad is set to be re-elected president of the Rashtriya Janata Dal for the ninth consecutive time, with no other leaders filing nominations for the post. On Friday, Mr. Prasad filed his papers. The election, if required, will be held on January 17.

Rabri Devi, wife of Mr. Prasad and former Bihar Chief Minister, proposed his name in the nomination submitted to the party’s national election officer, Jagdanand Singh. Mr. Prasad’s sons and Bihar Ministers, Tej Pratap and Tejaswi Yadav, and other senior leaders were present.

“Under his leadership, the party has reached great heights, and the workers have faith in Lalu ji so much that he will again be elected unopposed,” Ms. Rabri Devi told presspersons.

“The RJD has done well in the last Assembly polls under his command, and the party will also move ahead under his stewardship in the days to come,” Mr. Prasad’s younger son and Deputy Chief Minister Tejaswi Yadav said.

“Though the schedule for the election has been announced, it will be a mere formality as Laluji is set to be elected unopposed,” said a senior leader.
title: Lalu set to be re-elected RJD president
